Posts.Content: Oct 28, 2010 07:28PM CHRISTY2 wrote: I to am very sorry that you are having to go through all of this. I did the excisional biopsy with wire localization and it was not bad at all. The radiologist will numb your breast and with the aid of the mammogram he will insert the wire into the suspicious area and suture it into place. I felt no pain at all with it of course except the usual mashing from the mammogram. The biopsy was done under general anesthesia and I did not have much pain at all. It was a little tender is all and tylenol controlled my pain just fine. Good Luck and my fingers are crossed that you get good news! HUGS
